moves.1. c4: The result of this match wasn't much of a surprise, since my rating was over 250 points higher than my opponent. I like it solely for the checkmate that I pulled off. Apart from that I made a ridiculous error during the end of the opening stage of the game. I'll point out why I made certain moves after that point.
moves.1... e6 2. g3 c6 3. Bg2 Qf6 4. Nc3 Bc5 5: At this point, I felt that my position was too dominating to lose. But I made an error in not completing the development of my pieces and instead focused on pawn territory.
Such an obvious move. I simply wasn't paying attention.
moves.23. Qb1: I put my queen here so that I could take back F1 and get it back in a threatening position. Other options would require me to have to move again to avoid one of the black knights.
My plan at this point is to take advantage of the badly positioned king and take the weak D7 pawn.
moves.26... Nb3 27. Rd1: To that end I positioned my castle on D1. It helps that I moved it here in response to attack, so its purpose wasn't too obvious.
moves.30. Qd3 Raxb6 31. Qxd7+ Kf8 32. Nf6: This is to prevent the king from escaping behind the queen. There are many responses to this, but all of them lead to eventual checkmate.
moves.32... c5:
This avoids the following line:

            	        ...R6b7
33.	Qd6+	...Re7
34.	Qd8+	...Rxd8
35.	Rxd8+	...Re8
36:   Rxe8++
